admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
subsc: Agro-industry,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector,Housing finance,Central government administration,Agro-industry, marketing, and trade
trustfund:
TF034032-UKRAINE - AGRICULTURE,TF029341-PHRD - LAND REGISTRATION &
            AGRI. SECTOR ADJ. LOAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Agriculture Sector
            Adjustment Loan (Ag SECAL) is to support the growth of a
            market-based agricultural system. This will be achieved by
            instituting agricultural and trade reforms aimed at
            increasing market competition, encouraging private ownership
            and investment in land and other productive assets, and
            providing short term balance-of-payments support for
            financing critical imports. The reform program that the Ag
            SECAL support will improve agricultural terms of trade,
            increase input flows to farms, expand agricultural exports,
            and increase the efficiency of farm management. The Ag SECAL
            encompasses policy reforms and balance of-payments
            financing. The policy conditionally will focus on the
            agricultural sector and address the following: a) reduction
            in the export restrictions allowing increased access to
            export market; b) development of a well functioning land
            market; and c) enabling privatization and demonopolization
            of existing agribusiness firms and encouraging new entrants.
            The negative short-term adjustments associated with these
            policy changes will be cushioned by balance-of-payments
            financing. The funds provided under this component of the Ag
            SECAL will be used to finance general imports. The funds
            will be channeled through the National Bank of Ukraine, and
            allocated through the established market system for
            auctioning foreign exchange. While balance-of-payments
            support is not expected to be targeted at financing imports
            for the agricultural sector it is expected to improve the
            availability of agricultural inputs.
